video_caption: The video begins with a woman in a gray blazer and black top standing in a workshop-like environment, speaking to the camera. Behind her, a crash test dummy is seated in an orange and black crash test seat, surrounded by various equipment and tools. The scene transitions to a crash test of a gray sedan, marked with yellow and white sensors, as it collides with a barrier. The car's front end crumples, and the airbags deploy, capturing the impact in detail. The video then shows a close-up of the crash test dummy inside the car, wearing an orange suit and a blue helmet, with the deployed airbag visible. The final scene features a brown SUV, also equipped with sensors, undergoing a crash test. The text "Videos courtesy NHTSA www.nhtsa.gov/Research/Databases+and+Software" appears on the screen, indicating the source of the footage. The video provides a detailed look at crash test procedures and the deployment of safety features in vehicles.

The video begins with a dummy seated in a car seat on a red bench, secured with a harness, in a laboratory setting. A woman in a blue shirt and jeans adjusts the car seat, ensuring it is properly positioned, while a man in a black shirt observes. The scene transitions to a close-up of a computer screen displaying a control interface for a crash test setup, with options for 'Fill Mode' and 'Setpoint' and a 'Tank Pressure (PSI)' reading. The video then shows a crash test setup with a dummy in an orange seat, secured with a harness, positioned on a platform with a sign reading 'Kettering University Crash Safety Center' in the background. The dummy is shown in various stages of the crash test, with its arms raised and body slightly tilted, indicating the impact of the test. The video concludes with the dummy in a more reclined position, suggesting the aftermath of the crash test.

The video begins with a close-up of a car's dashboard, displaying various warning lights and gauges, including a speedometer and tachometer. The scene transitions to a woman in a pink outfit and a child in a car seat, both seated on a red couch, with the woman appearing distressed. The next scene shows a crash test facility with a sign reading "Crash Safety Center," where a crash test dummy is positioned in a car seat on a track. The dummy is then shown in a crash test, with the car's front end severely damaged. The video concludes with a view of the crash test dummy inside a damaged car, with the dummy's head and upper body pressed against the steering wheel, indicating the impact of the crash. The environment throughout the video is a controlled crash test facility, with visible equipment and safety measures in place.

The video showcases a crash safety center where various crash tests are conducted. A woman in a blue shirt and jeans is seen preparing a crash test dummy in a red outfit on a platform, while a man in a black shirt and jeans observes. The scene transitions to the woman adjusting a black car seat on an orange platform, with the man still in the background. The focus then shifts to two men examining a car's rear structure, one in a suit and the other in a red shirt, with the text "KAYSER-THRED" visible on the car. A crash test dummy is shown inside a car, with the text "Videos courtesy NHTSA" and a website link displayed. The video then shows a man in a black shirt and jeans operating a large metal apparatus, followed by a close-up of a hand adjusting bolts on a metal surface. The scene transitions to a view through a window into the crash safety center, where a man in a red shirt is seen working on a crash test setup. The video concludes with a wider view of the crash test center, highlighting the "Crash Safety Center" sign and the setup for crash tests, with arrows indicating the positive and negative directions of the tests.

The video begins with a woman standing in a laboratory setting, wearing a gray blazer and a black top, with a microphone clipped to her blazer. She appears to be speaking, as her mouth moves and her facial expressions change. Behind her, there is a crash test dummy seated in an orange and black seat, surrounded by various pieces of equipment and a large gray ball. The scene then transitions to a graph displaying velocity, acceleration, and displacement over time, with a red line indicating a peak acceleration of 25 g's. The graph is labeled with the "Crash Safety Center" logo and includes various data points and measurements. The video then shifts to a historical clip showing a person in a white helmet being assisted by others, with the text "Video 'Space Age Railroad' http://sctech.quickfound.net/" displayed at the bottom. The video concludes with this historical footage, providing a contrast to the modern laboratory setting and crash test data.

The video begins with a historical photograph of a man in a white flight suit and helmet, seated in an aircraft cockpit, with another person adjusting his harness. The text "Picture Courtesy www.ejectionsite.com" is visible, indicating the source of the image. The scene transitions to a blurred, fast-moving shot of a person in a red suit and helmet, suggesting high-speed motion, with the text "Video 'Space Age Railroad' http://scitech.quickfound.net/" providing context. The next scene shows a long, empty corridor with a red bench and a track, hinting at a testing or experimental environment. A man in a black and white striped shirt is then seen seated in a car seat on the red bench, with his legs raised, possibly simulating a crash test scenario. The video continues with a close-up of a crash test dummy in a car seat, secured with a harness, and a person adjusting the dummy's position. The scene shifts to a close-up of a mechanical device, likely part of the crash test apparatus, followed by a shot of a crash test dummy in a car seat, with a person adjusting the dummy's headgear. The final scene features a woman in a blue shirt and a man in a red and white patterned shirt, standing in front of a sign that reads "Kettering University Crash Safety," indicating the location and focus on crash safety research. The video effectively combines historical imagery, high-speed action, and crash test simulations to illustrate advancements in safety technology.

The video showcases a series of scenes within a workshop or laboratory setting, where various mannequins are being prepared and tested for safety purposes. Initially, a mannequin dressed in a white outfit is suspended by a yellow strap, with a woman in a blue shirt and black sleeves adjusting its position. The mannequin's head is marked with a yellow and black hazard symbol, indicating its use in safety testing. The background features other mannequins, some dressed in pink, and a digital clock displaying the time as 2:21. The scene transitions to a close-up of a mannequin's head, where a person is seen adjusting its helmet, emphasizing the meticulous preparation involved. The video then shows a group of mannequins, including one dressed in white and others in pink, seated in a row, highlighting the diversity in their designs and purposes. A mannequin dressed in white is then shown with a 3D coordinate system overlay, indicating the precise measurements and angles being taken for safety analysis. The woman in the blue shirt is seen again, this time adjusting a blue harness on the mannequin, with a man in a dark blue shirt observing the process. The mannequin is then secured in a testing apparatus, with the woman ensuring its stability. The video concludes with a scene of a car crash test, where a mannequin is seen inside a vehicle, demonstrating the real-world application of the safety measures being tested. The text "Videos courtesy NHTSA www.nhtsa.gov/Research/Databases+and+Software" appears on the screen, indicating the source of the footage and providing a link to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration's research resources. The video effectively illustrates the process of preparing and testing mannequins for safety, emphasizing the importance of precision and the practical application of safety measures in vehicle testing.

In the video, a woman with gray hair, dressed in a black top and gray blazer, stands in a workshop-like environment filled with various equipment and tools. She appears to be speaking, as indicated by her mouth movements and the presence of a microphone clipped to her blazer. The background features a large orange and black seat, possibly a specialized chair or equipment, along with other items such as a large gray exercise ball and a wooden cabinet. The woman holds up a small blue and white object, likely a piece of equipment or a tool, while continuing to speak. The scene transitions to a slide titled "Head Injury Criteria," displaying a mathematical formula for calculating the Head Injury Criterion (HIC). The formula is presented in a white box with a blue background, indicating a focus on safety standards or research related to head injuries. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere throughout, with the woman's attire and the workshop setting suggesting a technical or scientific context.

The video begins with a close-up of a graph titled "Crash Safety Center," displaying two plots: one for "moment (ft-lb)" and another for "resultant (ft-lb)" over time in milliseconds. The graph is detailed with multiple lines representing different data sets, and the axes are clearly labeled. The background is a blue gradient, and the text "Head" is partially visible at the bottom left corner. The scene transitions to a wider view, revealing the full title "Head Injury Criteria" and a mathematical formula for calculating the Head Injury Criterion (HIC) on the right side of the screen. The formula is presented as "HIC = [1/(t2 - t1)] ∫(adt)^(2.5) (t2 - t1)," with the integral sign and exponents clearly visible. The background remains consistent with the blue gradient, and the graph is still visible in the upper left corner. The video then shifts to a woman standing in a laboratory setting, wearing a gray blazer over a black top. She appears to be speaking, with a focused expression, and the background includes various equipment and a crash test dummy seated in an orange harness. The laboratory environment is well-lit, with visible tools and machinery, suggesting a professional and technical atmosphere. The video maintains a coherent narrative, transitioning smoothly from graphical data to a real-world application in a laboratory setting.

The video features a woman in a gray blazer and black top, standing in a workshop-like environment with various equipment and a crash test dummy in the background. She appears to be speaking, possibly explaining or discussing the setup. The scene transitions to a long, narrow track with red and blue markers, suggesting a testing or experimental setup. A person is seen walking down the track, indicating preparation for a test. The video then shows a crash test dummy inside a car, with a focus on the dummy's head and upper body, highlighting the impact of a collision. The dummy's head is shown with visible damage, emphasizing the severity of the crash. The video returns to the woman in the workshop, continuing her explanation or discussion, with the crash test dummy still visible in the background. The video concludes with a close-up of the woman, maintaining the focus on her as she speaks, with the workshop environment and equipment providing context to the discussion.

The video begins with a man in a black sweater adjusting a harness on a dummy wearing a helmet and a camouflage vest, set against a backdrop featuring a yellow and black caution sign. The scene transitions to a blue dummy seated in a car seat, secured with a seatbelt, inside a vehicle with a yellow caution sign on the headrest. The narrative then shifts to a lecture hall where a woman in a gray blazer and black top stands before an audience, gesturing as she speaks, while a bald man in a white shirt sits on a chair on the stage. The focus returns to the woman in the gray blazer, now standing next to a child safety seat with a dummy inside, in a workshop-like environment with various equipment and tools visible. The video then shows a close-up of a car's front end, with a label reading "Videos courtesy NHTSA www.nhtsa.gov/Research/Databases+and+Software," indicating the source of the footage. The scene transitions to a woman in a blue shirt adjusting a brown dummy with a yellow and black caution sign on its helmet, seated in a red car seat. The video concludes with the woman in the gray blazer standing in front of the child safety seat, speaking to the camera, with the workshop environment and equipment in the background.

The video features a woman standing in a laboratory setting, wearing a gray blazer over a black top, with a necklace and earrings. She appears to be speaking, as indicated by her mouth movements and facial expressions. Behind her, there is a mannequin seated in an orange chair, surrounded by various pieces of equipment and machinery, suggesting a research or testing environment. The scene transitions to a black screen displaying text that reads, "This video is: Produced By Kettering University www.kettering.edu Funded through keen Kern Entrepreneurship Education Network www.keennetwork.org." This text indicates the production and funding sources of the video, along with a Creative Commons license notice at the bottom. The video concludes with this informational screen, providing context about the video's origins and affiliations.
